alert.note: Alert for Cumberland (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 27 at 1:18AM EDT until June 27 at 3:00AM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 AM EDT EARLY THIS MORNING FOR NORTHWESTERN CUMBERLAND COUNTY... At 118 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Fayetteville, Fort Bragg, Pope AFB, Hope Mills, Spring Lake, Eastover, Bonnie Doone and Vander. This includes the following flood prone locations... Spruce St at Little Cross Creek, Blounts Creek near Robeson St, Cross Creek at Ray Ave, Little Rockfish Creek in Hope Mills, Big Sandy Run at US-301 south of Fayetteville and Hope Mills Rd and Camden Rd. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
